questions.question_text: Sarve’dhikāriṇo mokṣhe gṛuhiṇas-tyāgino’pi cha । Na nyūnā’dhikatā tatra sarve ______ yatah Prabhoho ॥ 17 ॥
questions.explanation: The shlok states that all are devotees of God.

questions.question_text: “...jene Bhagwānnī prāpti thaī chhe ane gṛuhasthāshramī chhe to paṇ te nirguṇ kahevāy ane tyāgī hoy te paṇ nirguṇ kahevāy.”
questions.explanation: This quote emphasizes the equality of gṛuhasth and tyāgī.

questions.question_text: Gṛuhasth tathā tyāgī sarve ______ adhikārī chhe. Temā nyūnādhik-bhāv nathī, kāraṇ ke gṛuhasth ke tyāgī badhā Bhagwānnā bhakto chhe. (17)
questions.explanation: Both gṛuhasth and tyāgī are eligible for moksha.

questions.question_text: “...gṛuhī-tyāgīno kāī meḷ nathī, jenī samajaṇ moṭī tene ja sauthī moṭo haribhakta jāṇavo.”
questions.explanation: Understanding is the key to being a great devotee.
One obtains satsang by taking the ashraya-diksha-mantra.

questions.question_text: Swāminārāyaṇ Bhagwānne viṣhe ananya, dṛuḍh ane param ______ māṭe āshraya-dīkṣhā-mantra grahaṇ karī satsang prāpta karavo. (18)
questions.explanation: Ashraya diksha mantra is accepted for ananya, drudh, and param bhakti.
This shlok describes how to attain satsang.

questions.question_text: Na nyūnā’dhikatā tatra sarve bhaktā yatah ______ ॥ 17 ॥
questions.explanation: This completes the shlok related to adhikari and moksha.

questions.question_text: Gṛuhasth tathā tyāgī sarve mokṣhanā adhikārī chhe. Temā nyūnādhik-bhāv nathī, kāraṇ ke gṛuhasth ke tyāgī badhā Bhagwānnā bhakto chhe. (17)
questions.explanation: This is the translation of shlok 17.
Ashraya diksha mantra leads to satsang.
